intro: Corispermum canescens, commonly known as the silverweed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It is a member of the Chenopodiaceae family, which includes many salt-tolerant species. The plant has small, green, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in harsh environments. Its flowers are typically green or yellow and appear in clusters. Corispermum canescens is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient conditions.
